Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice with cul and handle root; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black; two faded added white bands with traces of added red band between; possible traces of faded white bands near bottom of sherd; exterior: painted decoration consisting of bull (part of tail and hind leg remaining) to right; below, two dilute lines above cul decoration: handle frill pattern on left; part of large maeander pattern on right; below, brown band.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0439) (phase 2)
